After the APIs are exposed via WSO2 API Microgateway, you can invoke an API with a valid token(JWT or opaque access token) or an API key.
Lets use a sample JWT to access the API. Following JWT is a trusted  by the default micorgayeway client certificate trust store.

The below command will set the sample JWT to the shell variable `TOKEN`.

```bash
TOKEN=eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsIng1dCI6Ik5UZG1aak00WkRrM05qWTBZemM1TW1abU9EZ3dNVEUzTVdZd05ERTVNV1JsWkRnNE56YzRaQT09In0..KjNXGc1xNx_zuxg0mW_i8oGE517Y6ewJEWL9WBRXaCgEEYFYyLl-44bd18093QrYB3CkStKuw6_GTAvP_J6HEu9rO44vXhPNHosx_fB0t4n8OO9Gimp882syMiwy9mbpz4NEdMnrdTj-4l-7cCR4YrVcvdd_Z2zlQ9xLx_tq8gTLecnchE7Mb9dCQHgePjzh9a4OTpGparkyi-XOJ12ywyYhjwQK1C2uzyqeE0XpQzFzMZDtEktNmsP-AAEne27DVcvepJsUgDihhWQzsXBmnYV6zPHKG3pXlFCVhnVPIiC6RIA94tMle2_WjqFNZNQx0HqJyIH_vb2WeSO6DeUMvA
```
